newsitem.title: ROMANIA: ROMANIA'S RESERVE MONEY 14.6 PCT UP IN MARCH.
newsitem.headline: ROMANIA'S RESERVE MONEY 14.6 PCT UP IN MARCH.

text.p: The daily average of Romanian reserve money rose by 14.6 percent to 6.7 trillion lei in March after a decline in February, on the back of a surge in banks' minimum reserves, central bank (BNR) data showed on Thursday.
Reserve money, also known as monetary base or high-powered money, includes cash in circulation and in vaults and banks' minimum reserves.
Bank's minimum reserves soared to 1.75 trillion lei in March from 1.2 trillion lei the previous month, taking around 26 percent of the total monetary base.

Local bankers said the upswing in minimum reserves was an effect of rising residents' hard currency deposits. Latest data put those deposits at $1.94 billion in February, up from $1.83 billion at end-January.
The daily average of cash in circulation went up slightly to 4.7 trillion lei in March from February's 4.46 trillion. ($=6,985 lei)
